data.title: Commonwealth Journal
data.meta_description: Douglas Turner passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the Commonwealth Journal on 2023-01-19.
data.text:
Douglas Rayford (Wilson) Turner

Went home to live with our Heavenly Father on January 18 2023 after a long illness.

Doug was born July 8 1972 to Beulah Speaks Wilson Turner & Boyd DeWayne Wilson. He grew up in the Ano/Shopville community with his Mother and Father Kenneth (Deed) Turner.

He married his loving wife Atalie (Steward) Turner in 2019 and gained a wonderful stepson Elijah Steward.

Besides his wife Atalie & stepson Eli he leaves behind a son Brian (Wilson) Yonker, 2 sisters Darla (Bryan) Blalock from Knoxville Tennessee & Ila Wilson (John) Brooks from Greensburg, Indiana. He also leaves behind 3 stepchildren from a previous marriage Paige Turner, Patience Turner & Phillip (Taylor) Riley along with 6 grandchildren. He is proceeded in death by his maternal grandparents Rayford Speaks & Thelma Wells Speaks Watson. His paternal grandparents Homer & Olvie Wilson. A sister Wayna Raye Wilson. A nephew TJ Jasper & a brother-in-law Bronson Mueller.

Doug was loved by many because of his incredibly great personality. He lived life to the fullest up until his health no longer allowed him to.

Doug was of Baptist Faith, he loved his family and the Lord. He was a gentle giant that often carried the weight of others on his shoulders.

Doug has made a difference in many peoples lives due to his caring and concerning heart. All who met him loved him. He will be missed immensely by his family that loved him and the friends he met along the way in his journey here on earth.

Published on January 19, 2023

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
